attributes.action: "Brexit" on an advisory vote by a minority of the British population is wrong.
attributes.additional_details:
Only 37% of the electorate (equivalent to 25% of the population) voted to leave the EU.
Therefore 75% of the population did not vote to leave or were not eligible to vote. This is a gross injustice to the majority of the British population.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, call on the Prime Minister and the Government  to justify taking the UK out of the EU on the basis of an advisory referendum vote by a MINORITY of the electorate (37%) and therefore a MINORITY of the British population.

rejection.details: Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
